name: 2-vinylbenzoic acid
Reason: 2-vinylbenzoic acid has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. Starting with the basic unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C, we have a fused aromatic ring, which typically increases the melting point due to increased molecular rigidity and pi-stacking interactions; this effect is estimated to add about +25 °C for each additional fused ring. The molecular structure also includes a carboxylic acid group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +20 °C due to the presence of a hydroxyl group. Additionally, the vinyl group can contribute to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity, estimated at around +10 °C.
